item.title: Spain's Puig Intends to Go Public
item.description: Beauty group Puig said it plans to launch an initial public offering in Spain and reportedly raise around €3 billion in the process.

item.title: Israel Kills a Hezbollah Commander, as Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Show Progress
item.description: Hezbollah acknowledged the death of Ali Ahmed Hassin, who the Israeli military described as a brigade commander.

item.title: Alibaba Cloud Slashes Prices for International Customers
item.description: Alibaba Cloud is lowering prices for international users as it looks to attract more customers in the era of artificial intelligence, cutting some price tags by up to 59%.

item.title: Brent to Remain Below $100 a Barrel, Goldman Sachs Says
item.description: Brent crude oil prices are forecast to stay below $100 a barrel this year on expectations of solid demand and no additional hits to supply from geopolitical escalations, according to Goldman Sachs.

item.title: Gold Rises on Persistent Geopolitical Tensions
item.description: Gold futures rose 0.5% as bubbling tensions in the Middle East continued to offset falling interest-rate cut hopes.

item.title: FAA to Probe Loss of Engine Cover on Southwest Airlines Boeing Jet
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration is investigating an incident in which an engine cover fell off a Southwest Airlines-flown Boeing 737-800 jet during takeoff from Denver.

item.title: U.S. Dollar Fails to Sustain Gains After Strong Jobs Data
item.description: Having initially strengthened after much stronger-than-expected U.S. jobs data, the dollar soon succumbed to profit-taking, suggesting that U.S. economic news has become less important for the currency, Commerzbank said.

item.title: German Industrial Output Beats Expectations
item.description: Germany’s industrial production rose 2.1% in February, helped by a recovery in the construction and car industries.

item.title: Philippine Central Bank Holds Rate Steady to Tame Inflation
item.description: The Philippine central bank kept its policy rate unchanged, as expected, to rein in a recent pickup in inflation.

item.title: German Bunds Aren't Immune to Rise in U.S. Treasury Yields
item.description: German Bunds won’t be immune to rising Treasury yields Commerzbank Research said as it sticks to a cautious duration stance, adding yields may erode the upper end of the recent range around 2.45%.

item.title: China Holiday Activity Adds to Recovery Signs
item.description: China’s weak consumer activity got a temporary boost from the Qingming holiday ended Saturday, during which more travelers hit the road, adding to signs of green shoots in the world’s second-largest economy.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.9%, Led by Electronics, Auto Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in electronics and auto stocks, as strong U.S. jobs data bolstered confidence in the U.S. economy.

item.title: Shimao Shares Fall After China Bank Files Liquidation Petition
item.description: Shimao Group shares fell sharply after a Chinese state-run bank filed a liquidation petition against the heavily indebted developer, adding uncertainty to a proposed restructuring of offshore debt.

item.title: Doubts Creep In About a Fed Rate Cut This Year
item.description: Traders started the year predicting as many as seven rate cuts. Now, many are betting on one or two—or none.

item.title: A Fight Between Hamas and Other Palestinians for Power in Gaza Begins to Emerge
item.description: A simmering confrontation with the West Bank-based Palestinian Authority is a fresh sign of deep divisions over who will manage the enclave.

item.title: The Explosion of Asylum Claims Driving the Global Migrant Crisis
item.description: Laws meant to protect refugees from persecution are now used by vast numbers of economic migrants, nearly guaranteeing entry at borders and allowing applicants to remain while yearslong cases work through courts.

item.title: Some U.S. shelters for immigrants are instituting length-of-stay limits to conserve resources in the face of what states and cities see as inadequate federal support.
item.description: Some U.S. shelters for immigrants are instituting length-of-stay limits to conserve resources in the face of what states and cities see as inadequate federal support.

item.title: Ecuador faced widespread criticism after police raided the Mexican Embassy in Quito to detain a former Ecuadorean vice president granted political asylum by Mexico.
item.description: Ecuador faced widespread criticism after police raided the Mexican Embassy in Quito to detain a former Ecuadorean vice president granted political asylum by Mexico.

item.title: Party-line fractures over aid to Ukraine and Israel have blurred the possible outlines of a bill on help for Kyiv that Speaker Mike Johnson has pledged to bring to a vote in the House.
item.description: Party-line fractures over aid to Ukraine and Israel have blurred the possible outlines of a bill on help for Kyiv that Speaker Mike Johnson has pledged to bring to a vote in the House.

item.title: An Oregon lottery player won a $1.3 billion Powerball jackpot after Saturday night's drawing was delayed for several hours for security procedures.
item.description: An Oregon lottery player won a $1.3 billion Powerball jackpot after Saturday night’s drawing was delayed for several hours for security procedures.
